review: I have been on this med for about 7 months (150mg). Initially made me feel great with little side effects and it still does.  I smoked weed for about 4 of those 7 months until I quit cold turkey 2 months ago. I think the weed negated the rise in anxiety that wellbutrin usually gives.  Wellbutrin is known to increase anxiety so be weary but it can wear off in a couple of weeks to months. For me I take it with Clonazepam as needed but I take it daily almost because of the constant anxiety. For me I am not addicted cause I am on such a low dose (1mg) but I would like to try Buspar which I prob will. This pill gave me my motivation back that I lost for about 6 years. It allows me to get out of bed and not feel pity or sorry for myself. I usually take it in the mornings. BUT if you have GAD be weary as it can make your anxiety worse. But the way it makes you feel motivated can outweigh the crazy anxiety it can give.

I fortunately saw all the reviews and thought wow this medication looks like a godsend. I was on this medication for about 3 years by the last year and a half I started having a skin rash like severely and felt like where my nerves were all being hurt and in pain. Then I was having big holes in my skin and I had gained probably 70 80 lb I started at 130lb I went to 205lb by the end of it. I have gotten off this I've been off at for a week I have already lost 10 lb and I feel so much better I feel like my clarity is there I can actually feel things, like my libidos back - I have a sex drive, I didn't realise how much this medication had taken so much from me. Not everyone has the same experience on this I actually have less cravings to smoke off of it than I did on it. I smoked a lot on this medication now I'm barely smoking. So don't just go by everyone's 10 out of 10 review please be sure to see the red flags and the signs that come up because I didn't I kept thinking it was something else it was something else finally I stopped  it and ya :

I used to take Wellbutrin XL 300mg @ 25 years ago. It worked great! I'm not sure why I stopped taking it, but I'm on the 150mg XL now at age 50. My doc wanted me to take it with Viibryd 10mg daily. Don't do it! Horrible side effects from Vibryd & insomnia is terrible! I am just sticking with the Wellbutrin 150 XL or possibly going back to 300 XL!:)

Currently on 150mg. My vision constantly involuntary blurs, I’m always sweating, my body (especially my hands) tremors, and sometimes I become extremely hyper-aware of everything around me that it begins to feel unreal. Also, I’ve been getting bouts of times where I feel really suicidal. This medication used to work for me, but now? Does nothing positive, except raise my libido.

I was dealing with mega anxiety that was starting to turn into a deep depression.  I got on Wellbutrin about 2 months ago.  I started with 150 mg and  went to 300 in a little over a week.  I had minimal side effects.  I did notice the first few days and after the dose increase that I felt a little buzzy and had good energy.  I was concerned it would make my anxiety worse; it didn't.  Unfortunately, it didn't do enough for my anxiety (which it isn't usually used for that, which is why I'm still giving it a 9/10).  It pulled me out of a very dark hole, but I really needed something more geared towards anxiety.   Probably wasn't the best choice of meds for me, IMO.  But I really think it could be great for others especially with depression and low energy

My only sister was tragically killed in 2009 which put me in a deep dark depressed state. Unhappy always crying didn’t wanna get out of bed. Distant from everyone I basically shut the world out. This went on for 7 years or so. I finally told my doctor I was at the end of my rope and she gave me a prescription for 150 of wellbutrin XL it sat there for months because I didn’t want to depend on medicine to make me feel human again. Then I started to take it and it made me feel slightly better and then the thoughts came back in and I went back to my doctor and and told her so she upped my dosage to 300mg and I noticed a huge change but at first but I started to notice I was happier and smiling more I was getting up doing stuff and I started letting the world back in . I’ve probably been on it 3 years now and honestly I’m not sure I can function without it because I’m afraid of sinking back down to my lows again .
This medication has been a huge help. I used it as an add on to my Lexapro and lithium. It also helps my energy levels.

I was prescribed Wellbutrin XL 300 mg about 2 years ago for major depressive disorder and anxiety. During that time, one of my depression side effects was overeating and weight grain. After about a year of taking it, I just continued because I had a lot of hair loss and thinning. My hair has grown back since I stopped taking it 6 months ago, however, I felt my mood and energy decline. I asked my doctor to please put me back on, which he has. It has only been a week and I feel wonderful. My cravings are pretty much cut, I used to eat a lot of candy and chips as comfort food. Yesterday, I was craving something sweet and only had one mini twix and was satisfied. I'm now convinced that Wellbutrin actually does work for weight loss, however, I've not lost any weight this first week the way others have.
Things are never going to be perfect , but with Wellbutrin xl they’ll at least be better
This is a miracle drug. Sex life no good before this drug, I suffered with erectile dysfunction and it is so much better now. My depression has gone too.

On the first day, I had pain in my heart and chest of moderate intensityOn the second day, 5 hours after using the drugI had a heart attackThe sale of the drug should be banned and withdrawn from the market

I am on day 3 of taking 150 MG Wellbutrin XL, extended release. I was previously taking 10 MG Lexapro for 4 years. I found myself constantly fatigued, absolutely no libido and gaining weight. I'm a 44 yr, 145 lb, female. Day one I noticed immediate effect such as a calmness and I wasn't as sad. Keep in mind, I took a month off from no meds at all. I wanted to give my body time to adjust with not having the Lexapro in my system. Day 2 and 3, I noticed my appetite was suppressed. I wasn't as hungry as I was before. I have also been experiencing a slight headache. I am also dealing with insomnia.  I think I got maybe 1 hour of sleep the first night, second night, slept better but did wake up and had a hard time falling back to sleep. I will keep you updated and good luck to anyone taking this medication! I have read horror stories with mixing this with alcohol. I haven't tried it and almost scared to have a glass of wine...I'm not a big drinker but I'm scared to have at least 1 or 2 glasses of wine.

Have been on Wellbutrin generic 150 mg for a little over a year. I didn’t notice when it stopped working and looking back I did really well on it the first few months and then slowly started slipping back into depression. Doctor put me on 300mg XL generic starting yesterday, and fingers crossed that I get back to where I was before. Sad to say that the previous dose pooped out. I guess that’s how a lot of these meds go. Got up early this morning, very unusual for me, but happened when I first started Wellbutrin. I’ve gotten off the rails with my depression and having to pick up the pieces. I would say, keep a close eye on your depression and journal your emotions a couple times a day and adjust dosage.
Worked after about 5 weeks. Lifted mood and generally made me less irritable and more functional. My wife's says it has made me far more pleasant to live with. No side effects.

I will post daily for the first 30 days.Today is my first day starting Wellbutrin at 150 mg for my first week then 300 mg going forward.I'm taking it for severe depression, lack of energy, and to increase my mood.I'm currently also on 800 mg of Seroquel for bi-polar 1, and 150 mg of trazodone to sleep, both which are taken at night.

I’m on day 3 of Wellbutrin XL 150mg prescribed for ADHD. I was really nervous to start it because I don’t take any medications and live a very natural lifestyle. And I was worried about side effects. I had a very mild hint of a headache on day one( I also didn’t drink much water that day) and I feel that my head rage during exercise is a bit more excitable and fast but my resting heart rate remains 58-62. I’ll get my blood pressure checked later today. I never have much of an appetite so that hasn’t changed. I’m more focused, my intrusive rapid random thoughts seem to be getting caught by my internal filter instead of me just saying them, I’m more at ease, not as anxious or irritable, I’m able to slow down to go fast, feel happier, and just overall like I’m crushing life (no not in a manic way) I take it at 7-8am and find that I am more awake in the daytime and into the evening. I’ve been using a CBD gummy to help me sleep.

I’ve been taking this for a month now. Started with 150mg, all it did was make me super tired. Didn’t do anything for me besides gave me tremors and muscle twitches. I feel like I’m gonna burst into tears 24/7 but I can’t even cry. Did nothing for my energy or ADHD either. I’ve been upped to 300mg now and it’s only gotten worse. Hazy, tired, can’t cry, twitching. I don’t know if it’s worth waiting out to see if it gets better because my body isn’t reacting how it’s supposed to be. This was supposed to give me energy but it just makes me feel so run down.

Seven years ago the anti-depressant I was on stopped working, and I crashed into horrible major depressive disorder. My new doctor, guessing (wrong) that I had Bipolar Depression (I didn't), took me off anti-depressants and put me on Latuda, an "atypical anti-psychotic" often used to control Bipolar Depression. Not only didn't help the depression but also made me pace uncontrollable. I switched doctors, and the new one put me on Wellbutrin XL (long-acting). Eventually, my depression cleared, and I've been relatively depression-free (there are bad patches with any drug) for the past 7 years. I've had no noticeable side-effects, and I take it with first thing in the morning breakfast so it doesn't interfere with my sleep. I highly recommend it. (Full disclosure: I also take Imipramine, an old "tricyclic" anti-depressant, a couple of hours before bedtime. Helps me sleep well but dry-mouth side effect is annoying & bad for my teeth.)

I've lived through alot of trauma, I have been on  Wellbutrin XL for 10 years and recently stopped for 10 months. Today is my 6th day back on it and I am feeling less anxious about my circumstances in life right now. It has helped me daily get out of bed, control outburst, and overall keep moving forward. I would say I am lucky to have this medication.
Wellbutrin XL Medication was amazing! Improved my mood, energy, productivity and relationships. Only downside is I developed moderate/severe tinnitus so I had to come off. Really disappointed.

Wellbutrin has done wonders for me. I was diagnosed with Major Depressive Disorder in high school and was on a few different meds before being put on this one in college. It's helped me so much--if I ever feel myself getting into a "slump," I'm able to fight it off so much easier since starting this med.

I did not have a great experience with this medication overall. It ended up being the cause of my vivid dreams, not being able to tell what was reality or not. I was feeling more physically and emotionally drained. It might help some, it was just most definitely not for me.

I have been taking Wellbutrin 300 XL for about 3 yrs. It helps  my depression a lot. I am able to function daily and not overreact. Started at 150mg and went to 300mg. Before Wellbutrin , I was very depressed, and working , parenting, and everything was causing me grief, sadness, and fear. I was overweight and  I overreacted to small things. I felt hopeless and on edge everyday.I have a low functioning thyroid as well that may have been making my depression worse.So now I am on track. It took me about 2 weeks to feel a difference. Now I do have several of the side effects. I lost about 30 lbs. I have a low appetite, I have ringing in my right ear. I also have dry mouth, anxiety, trouble sleeping, and blurred vision.I can handles the side effects but not the depression. So I have stayed on the medicine. Also I suddenly stopped taking the meds one time and it caused suicidal thoughts and flu like symptoms.

This medication saved my life! I tried every different antidepressant. I was at my lowest and taking 2 antidepressants at the time. I never thought of suicide till then. I had nothing left, no hope, no joy. My Dr. prescribed 300mg Wellbutrin  XL once a day and I kid you not, I WOKE UP A DIFFERENT PERSON! No depression, great mood, no anxiety (like some say), pleasure and joy back, no racing thoughts, no fatigue, no restlessness. I'm me again!

Like most people with depression I have tried a lot of meds. But after a great deal of research I have found a great combination for myself. I refuse to take SSRI's due to zaps and sexual side effects. But when I combined Wellbutrin XL 150 mg with Sam-E 400 mg every morning, good things have happened. Depression is better and my fibromyalgia has subsided a great deal. Try it. You might like it. Just be cautioned, you may need something to help you sleep. But these two make you much more active.

I switched from Zoloft to Wellbutrin November 2019. When I first started I had of course beginning side effects from anxiety, stomach issues, appetite loss, etc. All those symptoms slowly passed and I noticed a change in my mood, as did others. I not only have depression but anxiety as well. When I started this my anxiety got worse then better then worse again, my doctor prescribed me buspar for my anxiety it did end up helping for a short time until recently. I had a very awful and my first panic attack. I decided to get off Wellbutrin as my anxiety was at an all time high. The withdrawal symptoms are not so great, but I’m glad I’m off of it. If you have depression then this medication is great but if you have anxiety I would consider a different route. Everyone is different and experiences medication differently so do not take what I said and apply that to yourself. Talk to your doctor and see what is right for you. Best of luck

I’ve been taking this for a little over 2 weeks now. Before this I was on Zoloft for almost 5 years. 6 years of my life I had constant thoughts of ending it. Ever since I’ve been on this medication I finally want to live. So far I’m having the basic side effects of most anti depressants, loss of appetite (although it is coming back), dry mouth, constipation/stomach pains, and being a bit more sensitive than usual. I would much rather deal with any side effects than wanting to end my life. I’ve read that some side effects will go away within time (since I’m only on my third week)

I started welbutrin 150 xl and I've been sick ever since. I vomit each time I eat and I feel real withdrawn. Now, almost 3 weeks into in today is the only day I haven't vomited after eating and I still feel good.  I think I'm getting better each day.  I gave it a 3 because I've never felt more sick in my life than I did when I started welbutrin.

I started taking 150mg about two years ago quickly went up to 300mg. My motivation went back to a normal level and I started painting, drawing and cooking again. My only issue was that I started getting daily headaches (after I had been on it for six months). My doctor put me on 150mg which got rid of the headaches, but my motivation got worse. I felt like I could do things I couldn’t when depressed, but also like I needed to convince myself to do anything extra. My doctor then gave me 5mg of lexapro on top of the Wellbutrin and its good. Recently got my blood work done for being fatigued, sleeping a LOT and brain cloudiness - its because I have a severe vitamin D deficiency. I highly recommend getting your bloodwork done if you feel like this suddenly loses effectiveness. A low vitamin D level can also cause depression which probably made it harder for me to feel better even on medications. Also look into getting this prescription from walmart, it is apparently $9

I take 450mg wellbutrin for MDD and other meds for bipolar 2, and no other antidepressants worked for me. Some of my other meds made me tired on top of depression making me exhausted and this gave me the energy I needed and pulled me back up out of it. It kills my appetite which is good because I’m guilty of stress eating. It’s knownnot chnaging your libido but my other meds do that so idk But overall this medication has been great for me

My first antidepressant when I turned 22. Currently take 150mg XL once a day. It definitely felt like a super drug for the first few months; happier mood, increased motivation, less food binging, happier sex life. Wellbutrin XL will eventually slow down in terms of effectiveness. But even without the "high" energy, I am in a better place with it. Don't do this-- I stopped taking them to see if I still needed them and that was a good laugh. No physical withdrawals but my suicidal thoughts came back. So I learned to just be humble and accept a life with *at least* no suicidal thoughts.

I am diagnosed bipolar I and MDD and I can say after many many meds this quite literally feels like it has saved my life. I have had energy and life since getting put on wellbutrin and recommend it to anyway struggling.
1 month and a half on Wellbutrin XL,  and it did not relieve my depression, my sexuality did not improve and I could not quit smoking. All I did was waste time and money.

I've been on Wellbutrin for years along with Celexa and Abilify. It seems like now I'm not even taking it. I think it worked pretty well at the beginning, but for me it has just lost most of its effectiveness. I have been having really low functionality with my depression for a couple years now, and my doctors keep saying that my energy and motivation should be fine because of the Wellbutrin (I take the highest dose too), but I think the depression is just stubborn now after so many years.Additionally, I have stopped taking it a number of times and I didn't have withdrawal, AND I didn't get more depressed. So it's like I'm taking nothing.

I was suffering from depression couldn't get myself out of bed for 1 year tried different things nothing works like wellbutrin XL. I started with 150mg and then increased the dose to 300mg. The effect started to show about the second week, made me get up and have my life back again.

I have been struggling with depression and anxiety for a long time every little task felt so overwhelming and when I had my baby it was just to much , Dr prescriped cipralex then zoloft and it didn't help much then I asked for wellbutrin. So my thoughts so far when the zoloft finally left my body and I got to 300mg of wellbutrin I had so much energy I accomplished a lot my libido skyrocketed I felt great a few weeks later I think it caused me to be manic, I felt high even my pupils in the mirror were tiny I felt super confident and sexual and I did whatever I wanted and did not care who I hurt. Then I came down and went back into a horrible depression and attempted ending it all over the way I acted when I was feeling so great , now that the sadness has leveled out I'm just irritable and snappy over nothing or laughing my ass off at things that aren't that funny I either get a bunch done or can't be motivated to move..

If at all possible you really need to use the name brand Wellbutrin if you're going with the XL version.  I thought this med was terrible (Bupropion XL), causing heart palpitations, confusion, nightmares, the list goes on.  I tried two different generics, both were terrible.  I read a few posts regarding issues with the XL version, as well as some FDA articles on removing the generic XL from the market in 2012 (that's not too long ago).  This got me wondering if it was the time release mechanism of the generics causing all of my side effects. I have been taking it for over a month now with miraculous results.  Side effects are non-existent, happiness is back, motivation is back, sex drive is back.  This med truly is a miracle for me.  It's also helping so much with my ADHD, to the point I've all but stopped using any stimulants.  Please, before you right off this medication try to get the name brand.

I used to have 0 motivation. I could not get out of bed for weeks at a time. I ate whatever food I had and peed in bottles because I couldn’t make the effort go to bathroom; even though bathroom is across from my room! On second day of taking Wellbutrin XL 150mg, I found myself washing my dishes! It surprised me! And it continued to get better from there.Now after about 6 weeks, I’m back in school, working, eating, exercising, meditating, my room is spotless, car is clean, I shower every day and I’m more motivated than I have ever been.A few tips:1. As helpful as this med is, you can’t just rely on this to help you. You must create healthy lifestyle (eat, exercise, sleep, etc). After all, health comes from healthy living.2. You might get insomnia and nightmares. To help with insomnia I take 300mg magnesium glycinate and melatonin. It helps but it’s not 100% effective.3. You won’t get hungry, but remember to eat at least 2,000 calories.

I have only been on this medication for 2 days and right off the bat am noticing some slight stomach upset and nausea. I have tried countless other antidepressants before, with Zoloft, Paxil, and Trintellix not working for me for various reasons, mostly including an enormous amount of weight gain in a short period and nausea. I have always wanted to try this medication, mostly because I heard it usually does not cause weight gain; after losing almost 40 pounds, I would be devastated to gain it all back.

I have taken Wellbutrin since 1984. I liked that it eliminated my sex drive. I didn't like that it got rid of my ability to recall dreams. Surprisingly, it also inhibited my ability to cry. It numbed me, allowing me to retain jobs for most of the past 35 years.Yes, Wellbutrin has saved my life, kept me employable, checked my over-the-top sex drive and numbed me. Recent health issues kept being labled as 'depression' by medical people until I gave my doctor a list of blood and urine tests I wanted. I was finally diagnosed as pre-diabetic, low Vitamin D levels and excessively low iron - not depression. So I'm back on 150 mg of Wellbutrin, as I've been on and off it for nearly 35 years.

After previously being on the common prescribed SSRI, Prozac, the enormously unhealthy weight gain and a regression in progress prompted a change in medication. My professional thought we’d give Wellbutrin a try. It’s only been two months and I’ve quickly bounced back to the best I’ve felt in over a year (compared to months later on Prozac, but could be attributed to better knowledge and expectations). But the weight loss has absolutely dramatic. I’ve lost at least 40 pounds that I’d steadily gained over the last year in no more than two months.

I started taking Wellbutrin XR 150MG after having major depression and tried several other medicines over 3 years. Other medicines worked well but partially & with side effects incl. sexual ones. Before Wellbutrin, I had no interest in doing LOTS basic  things I used to do. After I started Wellbutrin 150mg, positive signs started just after few days after, peak was after 4-5 weeks. Wellbutrin gives energy and motivation to do things. The only drawback is that this energy sometimes continues even after midnight. So sometimes I could stay awake till morning without feeling tired or mentally exhausted when I go office which yielded to some mild anxiety. To overcome this issue, my doctor gave me another medicine to help with it. And now all is PERFECT.Note: you may not face the same side effects I had. Finally, I have no sexual side effects with Wellbutrin unlike with my old medicines.

Since patients come to this site to gauge whether to try a new prescription, I'll describe how Wellbutrin XL 150mg has affected me in one week.   I asked my doctor to switch from Celexa since it was just OK, but not as effective as I wanted.   The first side effects I have been experiencing are: drowsiness in the mornings (not fatigue, but cold medicine), heart palpitations (when I have tea or coffee in the morning; coffee is 10x worse no matter when I drink it, even decaf).   Also, in the afternoons or evenings I get this heavy, weighted feeling all over my body, like it's too hard to lift arms and legs, plus added sleepiness.   On the plus side, I have not felt depressed or unmotivated. Above all, my libido has gone from 0 to 100 in a few days (I have never been completely mentally and physically engaged in sex before; something on my mind always got in the way).

It took a month or so but honestly the best medication I've ever been on. I tried over 15 different things before and finally wellbutrin allows me to feel happy and depression is much more manageable. I will say side effect wise I have a decrease in appetite and have lost around 12 pounds in 4 months. I am also more easily angered based on my menstrual cycle.
This drug saved my life and cured my major depressive disorder. I can now live a normal life again to its fullest.

Wellbutrin worked very well for me and did so in a matter of weeks.  I started at 150mg SR per day and felt somewhat better.  When increased to 300mg XL I felt virtually normal.  I don't know if it saved my life, but it certainly let me feel life was worth living.  The only side effects I have had are slight weight loss and somewhat more energy.  Both of these side effects are actually welcome.

I have only been in bupropion XL for 2 and a half weeks I'm on it for MDD. But that being said I can see it starting to work. I am not as anxious as I normally am. My thoughts seems more rational and aren't spirally out of control like they normally do. I was on Celexa for years but found it wasn't working and climaxing was such a struggle to achieve . My female libido is really coming back to what it was 20 years ago! I really am excited that I am starting to feel more happy and not so easily irritated. Give it a try if you are struggling. I'm sure it's not for everyone but , you won't know until you try :)

Wellbutrin was a terrible medication for me. It gave me a lot of anger, my mood worsened much more and loss of libido. But the worse side effect was a MAJOR and TOTAL loss of memory. Never taking anymore.
I’m having trouble functioning and would like to stay in bed all day, but am pushing myself to do things.
Sadly, I have been on 300xr and I have been so depressed. I went off of it and felt like myself again.
I had so many side effects from wellbutrin, it was too hard to handle. I had a fever, heard ringing in my ears, and was extremely dizzy. My doctor told me to stop taking it immediately.

I've been on this for a couple of months now.  At first, my heart rate was sky high no matter what and I shook a lot.  So my heart rate is still high, but not as high.  And I still shake, but not as much.  It did help me quit smoking and lose weight.  I am not sure what the side effects would be of Aplenzin, but I might try that.  Keep in mind, I'm on the highest dose with a mood stabilizer, Abilify, and Buspar.

I’ve probably taken placebo pills that have worked better than Wellbutrin. It does absolutely nothing, and it makes me appreciate the prescription drugs I have taken before that I didn’t think were doing their job. I still have really dark thoughts  from time to time and my depression has been ghastly lately. Hands down the least effective antidepressant I have ever taken.

I am a 25 yo female. I started taking Wellbutrin XL150mg after being diagnosed with MDD in April. I have done CBT in conjunction with taking medication. On Wellbutrin I feel more energetic, focused, & present. The black haze I saw my life in cleared and I feel normal.The main side effects I feel are:-increased energy soon after I take it -insomnia-appetite suppression.- some impulsivity-some forgetfullness-irritability sometimes-during high stress events I felt a build up of nervous energy & a 'drunk' feeling.I did try other doses. -75mg once daily did nothing for me. -100mg of an instant release once daily for a month. I felt an instant energy & focus in the mornings but by the evenings my mood would fall very deeply & found evenings difficult to get through. @100mg I didn't experience appetite suppression, insomnia, irritability or impulsivity.I plan to continue 150mg wellbutrin xl and may elect to take an SSRI to help with anxiety.

I have major depression disorder & panic moments (that’s what I prefer to call them). I take 10mg of Escitalopram & 150 mg of Wellbutrin XL spaced out by 2hrs . Wellbutrin was added as Escitalopram does not last 12 hours.  I’ve been taking Wellbutrin for 2 weeks now, no side effects 1st week however this week I’ve had: headache, nausea, my big toe gets a numbness or tingle. (I’m a runner so this bugs me) frequent urination, a slight loss in appetite, I also get nauseous & gassy after I eat or drink coffee and I seem to have more bowel movements but not diarrhea. Not sleeping thru the night has happened twice. I can still have a panic moment if I think about things too much so I use Clonazepam or Lorazepam when needed. I do not feel any different (in a bad way) since I’ve started taking it. I did try Zoloft and it was a nightmare, so I know the difference. I would recommend trying it, but stoping if any wild side effects begin.

I have struggled with anxiety and depression for years. I’ve tried some other meds and they’ve all made me crazy. I’m usually anti pharma but I have no regrets taking this again. I’m also taking St. John’s wort and I feel like the combo really works for me. My sex drive is back, my motivation is through the roof, I can focus and concentrate again, most of my brain fog has lifted. I wake  up and feel a sense of calm. It has also helped with my anxiety. Things don’t bother me much anymore. It doesn’t numb my emotions though. I actually feel excited, joyous, happy, confident. I’m so grateful for Wellbutrin because it’s given me myself back. I’m less angry. I’m less likely to react and fight with my partner. I’m on 300 mg. I highly recommend it but I do know everyone is different and this is just my experience! I wanted to share because of how much it’s benefited my life! I’m a better mom, friend, and partner because of it.

I was on 150mg Wellbutrin for depression. The first few months and has no side effects besides very mild nausea (which is a miracle for me). Then they increased my dose to 300mg once a day, and the side effects really started taking its toll on me. I had night terrors that would leave me awake for multiple hours each night when I would finally come out of it. The nausea was making me vomit from the smell of any food. I was really upset because it was really helping as far as my depression goes, but the night terrors were too much for me to handle. Only sleeping 1-3 hours at night isn't worth it to me.

I've been taking 150 mg of bupropion xl for years and it kept me from hurting myself but still had manic depressiveness. I also dealt with seasonal depressive disorder. It was taking the edge off. I wanted to feel able to do things without thinking of every negative possibility. My Doc raised the dosage to 300mg and my feelings also became elavated and feel alive again. Sad to say it has been two weeks and I have developed gouty arthritis in my right elbow and it is not going away. I was trying to not call the Dr. because of the good feelings I am having but the elbow is to painful and I feel it starting in my left elbow and fingers. I had gout in my feet never in my elbow until my sister mentioned that it sounds like gout and from the feeling and redness with the pain, it is what I felt years ago when I was drinking. Sober for 8 years

I have no doubt that this has helped many people...but for me, this was absolute poison. I'd gone off Lexamil and switched to Wellbutrin 300mg for MDD. My moods are absolutely all over the place. I'll randomly get sad for absolutely no reason and for a logical person, this gets frustrating. Not to mention the strain that most of my relationships have been under because of my now explosive temper. I don't feel like the person that I know that I am.

I have been quite depressed with extreme anxiety, obsessive and compulsive behaviors, Extremely hard addiction to nicotine and some dissociative-psychotic features  since 2016 and tried a whole different variety of SSRIS, SNRIS, Mood Stabilizers, but this one at 225mg XL 7 Day is like a custom-made pill for me! 0 desire to smoke, 100 desire to live, socialise, feel empathy and have healthy relationships, the anxiety I can't say for sure it's completely away but i can say for sure that it has lowered at least 65% I feel like I had gone to sleep in 2015 and waked up in december 2017, no side effects so far.

I’m hypersensitive to everything so I was very nervous to start this medication knowing that it would probably cause anxiety symptoms and I already have an anxiety and panic disorder. But I was very happy to find out that it did not affect me that way at all. I have not felt the jitters that I heard about or anxiety. I have not been on it long; I just started it within the last few days. I’m on 150mg/1X a day for now. I’m just very happy to find out that I am not suffering from a bunch of side effects (knock on wood).

Dealing with PTSD for 20+ years has been a blurry nightmare with very few gasps of air. My anger had gotten uncontrollable even though I thought it was. I have been on haldol, lexapro, and a couple of others . I have to admit welbutrin saved my marriage and more. The first few weeks were pretty rough but after that I can actually end an argument or conversation that's not going well without blowing up ..

I was taking this for about 6 years. From 13-18. I had a few spotty teen years where I would barely take the meds and I ended up in the hospital many times. I had a very weird and high sex drive and right when I got off it went away.  I had intense night terrors  and would start yelling in my  sleep, I would sweat so much it looked like I wet myself. The nightmares got so vivid and intense I was confusing reality with my dreams, I would constantly have to ask people if something had happened or not. I lost weight when I was taking this regularly. I've been off for almost two years, and all that being said I think I may start it up again. It was one of the only depression meds that kept my emotions but kept the bad ones away for the most part

I'm on 150 mg Wellbutrin XL's, and since I've started taking them, I've noticed my dreams are extremely vivid and disturbing, I'm getting confused easily, major insomnia, which isn't normal for me by any means. Was on Prozac, then Lexapro, switched to celexa after 3 doses, and now I'm stuck with Wellbutrin. I was told to push through and keep taking it, but all of my experiences with stimulants with an amphetemine base have been unpleasant. Im probably going to discontinue it, I'd rather be unmedicated than lose days of sleep and have horrible dreams whenever I can sleep. Not a great experience imo

In the last 6 years I have taken a few meds for my depression. Started with Lexapro which helped but caused very quick weight gain. Switched to Cymbalta which caused rash. Switched quickly to Prozac which caused horrible dreams and sexual issues!! Was then put on Wellbutrin by a psych NPR because of my issues with weight gain and sexual side effects. Drug was a miracle for me!!! Lost 45lbs in 2 years after starting it and sexual side effects disappeared!! Started out on 150mg a day but upped to 300mg a day when I had a depressive episode!! Since upping dose have had no issues other than unusual dreams, but can live with that!! Nothings perfect!!!
I had to stop the drug after 5 doses as it gave me tinnitus.  I was not prepared to possibly risk hearing damage.

So I was on Lexapro 20mg for 3 months and it helped somewhat with my very SEVERE depression that I was suffering from with severe anxiety, It was HELL! So my next appointment with the nurse practitioner I was prescribed bupropionXL and she told me to add it to my lexapro and too take both together, but as soon as I started too take them both I got very emotionally sad and numb, so my sister told me to stop taking the lexapro to give the bupropion a chance to work on its own and that has helped so much because now I feel a lot better then before and I'm only taking 150mg XL. Just wanted to share my experience with anyone.

I've been taking this medication for under 6months now and I have gained 10lbs while taking this drug. I don't feel like I have increased energy than before like some other people described. I feel more irritable & anxious at times, still can't sleep at night. I get the dry mouth side effects and occasional constipation.  I'm taking 300mg XL once a day. I am getting more depressed with gaining weight on this drug! I was taking Lexapro before & didn't find it help me feeling less depressed & experience  alot of nightmare or weird dreams while taking Lexapro!

I am currently using wellbutrin xl (150mg) a day as an add on to trintellix. I have been on every medication under the sun & always seem to have negative side effects. My biggest struggle with my depression is fatigue & no energy. I've only been on wellbutrin 5 days & I feel a tremendous difference. I am awake in the morning & don't feel like I am going to fall asleep at random times during the day. I also haven't taken a nap in 5 days either which is huge considering I always nap. I am a little anxious sometimes & am also dealing with sleeping issues so I may talk to my Dr about switching to the SR. I am also dealing with a lot of muscle spams but this always happens when I adjust a dose or try a new medication. Wish I tried this sooner!

Suffered three  mental breakdowns, hospitalised three times & off work each time four months each. I am on Wellbutrin XL 300mg once daily in a.m. and find I can function fully during each day; also take 'Adco-Alzam' 0.5mg twice daily to suppress panic attacks. Been on this for >8 years; and have got my confidence back!! Symptoms UNDER CONTROL!!! At last confidence and quality of life, not going off these again.... NEVER!

I live with depression and anxiety. Generic Wellbutrin has given me none of the sexual side effects I experienced with SSRIs like Zoloft. Seems to help me get out of the house. I'm on 150mg every morning and I'm trying 200mg soon. 300mg was too much for me.

MY person experience may differ for others, but BEST combo for me so far, has included Wellbutin XL 300mg. Many years receiving mental health services (27 years). Had to stop SSRI's. Wellbutrin however helped increase my motivation, had none. Was so bad I laid in bed months from severe depression, so long immobile that both legs filled with blood clots and near death!! Survived on blood thinners and hospital over a week. With Wellbutrin had no weight gain, lost the 50lb other meds helped put on me! Lower cholest., quit smoking as a nice bonus and no sexual issues, in fact helped imho.

I was on the 75mg SR formulation for a week before taking two a day. Went to 150 XL the next month and 300 XL after that. Been on it for about 3 months now. I love this medication. It's changed my life. I don't feel depressed very often anymore and combined with therapy, my life is substantially better. No side effects at all! Much better than Lexapro, which gave me bad sexual side effects.

This did nothing for me, as far as I'm concerned, I think its a placebo.. I was very depressed because I felt awful everyday, I could barely get out of bed, I felt exhausted, foggy mind, body ached, and long list of other debilitating symptoms.. I knew I wasn't just feeling these things physically for no reason. I'm only 30yrs old and when I started having memory problems I knew that it wasn't just Depression!! My primary doc did blood work and found I had some severe vitamin deficiencies! I got some prescription vitamins and changed my diet.. I feel better physically and mentally!! This may not help everyone but I encourage you to make sure your doc does a lot of tests tests to rule out others health issues before before blaming depression

I've only been on this medication since the 18th of this month, but one thing that I have noticed with this medication is that it is helping me to not have a constant appetite.  I was not only needing help with depression, but I was also needing help with weight loss and at this point I don't know how the weight-loss will/will not work with med, but I do know that I do not have an appetite like before taking this. And for that I am very grateful. I also understand that it could take 3 to 4 weeks before I notice the effects for the depression.  I am hopeful!

I have been on and off different SSRI's and none of them have helped e.g. slept my life away, foggy mind, couldn't concentrate, no feelings, constant ringing in my ears, low libido. I started on Wellbutrin XL 150mg for 1 month and my doc upped my dose to 300mg. My experience has been super wonderful, from sleeping too much I am now going to bed later at night and getting up earlier & feel refreshed. I cry when I need to which to me is a good release. I am always busy. I have redone my whole home & garden, I go out more (use to be a total recluse). I sit & have my coffee out on the patio & watch the bird life and find so much joy in every day life. I have found an inner peace with Wellbutrin XL that I have never felt before. Big thumbs up :)

I've been taking 15mg remron at night for sleep and also to help out with the depression when I wake up in the morn! I recently started the wellbutrin xl for about 5 weeks now and I think its a good mix for me.  Before the wellbutrin I was always tired and not into anything! Feeling down yet once I started wellbutrin it brought me back to life! I can finally do things and be happy about doing stuff. So far so good! I'll keep ya posted...

Increasing dose from 150mg to 300mg daily stopped suicidal ideation, but did not improve anhedonia. Increased dose associated with onset of hemidyskinesia, which diminished on lowered dosage and resolved completely when drug stopped.

Wellbutrin XL (Buproprion) has helped me kick cravings for alcohol and other drugs. It's really amazing. My doctor prescribed it for major depressive disorder/ptsd and I can feel it helping me get through the winter. I started out on 150mg for 2 months which was fine, then one month on 300mg which was too much (every day stomach-aches, shakes, too much energy, very speedy) so  doctor put me back on 150mg XL which is again working nicely and all the shaky/speedy feeling I had on 300mg is gone. My first 2-3 months on this drug I didn't have much of an appetite but it came back after that so now I still eat normally even though I'm on the drug. So yeah, It takes some getting used to. Don't expect immediate results.

I was 26 years old and taking Wellbutrin for about 5 months. Within those 5 months I became increasingly unmotivated, less energetic, and my depression worsened. I had terrible mood swings and was generally unpleasant to be around. My thoughts were not my own anymore, as I had horrific thoughts that were scary and confusing to me. Then came the night that I swallowed an entire prescription bottle of it. My thoughts were that either it would finally work and make me happy or it would just kill me so I wouldn't suffer anymore. I am obviously still here and I am so grateful for that! I stopped it and was put on Paxil. So much better for me! I'm a happy girl again!

Wellbutrin XL has been great for me. I have been on it for a few months and have completely noticed the difference in my lifestyle and my libido. My doctor was giving me samples of the brand name but she ran out and my insurance wouldn't cover the brand.  My Copay for the brand was $1300.00   I could NOT afford that so she reluctantly put me on the generic. It was HORRIBLE. Worst experience of my life. Worst side effects ever. Luckily I came across another Pharmacy and they fill your Wellbutrin brand name for $50 a month. It's been great! Back on Wellbutrin and feeling amazing!!

Brand name Wellbutrin XL 450, severe Gain weight, severe anger, severe stomach pain, severe constipation, severe vivid nightmares, Made me from social normal person, to an unreal horror human, scare to the world .... More than 90 days I can't even get out of my room....severe Panic attacks!!!
Worse medication every. Dry mouth,headaches,nauseous, rashes on the skin.. I'm still dealing with the rashes on my skin,they come and go....

I have been taking this medication since August 2015, and it has been the best one for me yet. I started with Celexa then went to Zoloft, and Zoloft worked for a bit but once things began to get difficult again I had to switch to another one, which was Wellburtin. It helped with some minor ADD problems, and overall my energy and positivity went up. I also began going to therapy again, and I 100% recommend that you do go to therapy in conjunction with antidepressants. Understand that if you don't like your therapist go to another one. You have to trust them and be able to open up to them to allow them to help. Medication only lifts the fog from your mind, but therapy is what allows you to move on with your life and not feel like a zombie.

For the past five years I have been battling depression. I feel extremely fatigued and unmotivated with thoughts of wanting to be dead. Life is totally miserable most times. I went from Cymbalta to Wellbutrin and after a few weeks I started to feel alive again. After about a year on it now I am back to my old depressive ways and my doctor is reluctant to start me on something new. So right now I am miserable again and waiting for my doctor to try something different. I wish all the best to everyone out there fighting this terrible disease!

This has been a life saver! Totally changed my life. I have tried SSRI many kinds to deal with my MDD with horrible side effects/ only slight headaches with wellbutrin;) I am very pleased with the results.  It's been almost 2 months no sludge on the  brain!!! THANK YOU!! I am GRATEFUL!!

I highly recommend Wellbutrin XL. I used to suffer from major depression, but thanks to the Wellbutrin, my depression is almost nonexistent. Another great thing about it is I don't have any side effects. In the beginning, I lost my appetite & everything tasted bland. I was fine with that because I wanted to lose some weight, but thanks to my other medications my appetite came back. Darn! Maybe if you take it & want to lose weight you will get lucky as long as you don't take other medications to counteract it.

Wellbutrin was without a doubt the most effect antidepressant I've ever taken. Unfortunately, a month and a half into treatment on 150mg XL/day I started getting cystic acne. It was terrible and I knew it had to be the Wellbutrin so I looked online and noticed other people complaining about getting Acne as well. It was terrible, it only made my depression worse because I had this big cystic lumps on my face. A month after tapering off and taking antibiotics prescribed by my dermatologist it finally went away but I went back to being depressed.

I have tried many different kinds of antidepressants but I must say that Wellbutrin XL300mg has been the best. I have been on it  for  3 years. I am so much happier and just feel better in general. The only side effect I have had while taking it is dry mouth. I was always a calm, attentive student even before I had the medicine. But since I have been taking it so long, if I happen to miss one or more days of taking it, I act as if I have ADHD. I am unable to focus and talk like a Chatty Cathy. If you have ever seen a little seven year old with really bad ADHD.That's me. I will skip in place, bounce up and down, and what not. I have NEVER had ADHD or ADD (I am super calm), but if I don't take it I act like it. That's my one and only problem.

Bad bad side effects from Wellbutrin xl , major palpitations, dry dry mouth, crying, couldn't sit still, and panic . After taking for 2 weeks. Nausea is debilitating . Worse medication I have ever had , back on Paxil cr

Recently I switched from Lexapro to Wellbrutrin XL due to what seemed to be decreased efficacy. I have never been so miserable in my life! After 2 weeks I was feeling dizzy and had vertigo which my doctor said should subside. The good news is that it did. The bad news is I started feeling tingling and numbness in my hands and feet. This feeling did not go away. I also experiences nausea, vomiting, severe agitation and general malaise. After 5 weeks of being on Wellbutrin I called my doctor and told her my symptoms. She has put me on Effexor but I can't start the medication till my symptoms go away which I hope will be soon cause I think my family has about had it with me this last month. I hope Effexor helps and soon! Take care everyone!

I started taking bupropion XL 150mg a day I took that for a month, the first 3 weeks I felt kind of cloudy/lost, had a little bit of anxiety and had some pretty bad ups and downs with my depression but by the end of the month I felt a lot better and didn't even feel like I was on a medication at all. I just started my second month and was upped to a 300mg dose. I'm on my 5th day and so far have had really bad anxiety attacks feeling like I'm losing control/ stuck in my own head most of the time and sleeping a lot. I'm hoping I can stick it out like with the 150 and start feeling normal again. I almost quit in the first 3 weeks of 150 but I stuck it out after reading positive reviews and it got better. I'm hoping that happens with the 300mg.

I have been on bupropion xl 300 for around 6 months and I'm really glad that I stuck through it. For me it definitely got worse before it got better. Around the second and third month my anxiety had me on edge and I had a very short temper. The positive definitely outweighed the negative though. I'm no longer sleeping all day, I finally have the energy to workout and carryout basic activities, and no more emotional eating. As a result I've lost 25 pounds and it has really helped me with my confidence. Not everyday is great but thats just part of life. I'm no longer irritable and my anxiety is not perfect, but manageable. I finally feel like I'm taking control of my life. If you can stick it out past the 3 month mark I think it's worth a try
I found that Wellbutrin XL benefit both my mood (stabilized) and helped me with a learning disability. I am able to track numbers and remember a longer sequence of numbers for short term memory.

January 2015 I was on Remeron 15mg by April 2015 I was at 45mg Remeron.  I felt normal and happy but I gained 26lbs.  Sept 2015 I was switched to Effexor 150mg  because of issues caused by the weight. By October I was on 300mg Effexor.  Today is day two of 150mg Wellbutrin.  I am suffering headaches from going from Effexor to Wellbutrin.  Tomorrow I increase to 300mg Wellbutrin. I can say that day two on Wellbutrin and I am not feeling as numb (unemotional) as I was two days ago. That's a positive.  This is definitely a rollercoaster ride in trying to find the right meds to help with my major depressive disorder, anxiety/panic attacks and insomnia.  My only regret is that I didn't get help sooner.  Instead I suffered alone for years.

I started 2 days ago, I had a bought of diarhea, but nothing major, I'm not giving up. I went straight to wellbutrin xl from zoloft, no reaction there. Anybody else had any diarhea, hoping this will disappear.

I was on generic for about a year. Didn't really do anything. I recently (a little over a month ago) went back to get a different prescription. Doctor decided to put me on name brand, at 300mg. Night and day difference. I can't remember the last time I didn't hate everything about life. It's been at least 6 years I've had major depression. I've been suicidal for about 4. It sucked. But this drug really has helped me. I actually enjoy things now, my life has color again, and I have more energy and a less difficult time focusing. It's really great.

Today is my first day taking it, and I am faithful it will work. My doctor has placed me on Vibrid but that was $100 out of pocket cost. Though I did find it helpful, my insurance copay for it and my budget will not allow me to continue usage. Got off of it for 3 weeks, now starting this one. I have faith - we shall see.

This was possibly the worst thing the Dr. could have given me . Granted, he didn't know any effect it would have on me, but never again!  After about a week or two I had to stop taking them. It actually increased both my depression and anxiety. I was always tired, but I was super jittery as well. My mother informed me that I looked like I was on meth. Thanks, mom!

I have more energy and want to clean things up that I haven't cleaned in awhile because all I wanted to just sit around and didn't care.I felt better after the second day,Im having a problem with talking bad about some people but I think I have been holding my feelings back for along time,I just  now Im seeing I don't care what they think, which is good for me because I've always been trying to be happy around these people that would make fun of me and talk bad about me behind my back. Since it's family I have to been around them ever now and then put Im able now not letting it matter and being able to let my feelings out. I have to lose weight and its been a week and Im able to control now to think about food before just eating it up and not care.

I was diagnosed with chronic depression, and anxiety in 7th grade. Now a junior in HS , I have been through trial and error with many medications including Pristiq, Prozac, Effexor, Latuda, and Zoloft for depression. For anxiety I have been on Abilify, which made me gain about 65 pounds in 8-9 months. Since 7th grade I have been diagnosed with borderline personality disorder, which my depression worsened with,  and I have very bad anger issues. I now take 30 mg of propranolol (anxiety) and 150 mg of Welbutrin, and the two medications work very well together. It took about a month or 2 for me to notice any changes after staring Welbutrin, but this has been the most effective med. by far, & I have lost about 30 pounds in the past 3 months!

I had a rough time starting young with major depression and anxiety since middle school. My freshman year I started taking Lexapro. It was the worst possible thing that could've happened to me. Worst side effects ever. I gained over 40 pounds. I was tiny and petite to being around 125 to 170. Tried switching from many multiple different meds, still gained weight. Then my doctor finally put me on Wellbutrin, started off with the low dose and didn't really help much. She upped me to 150. I had hyperglycemia and finally got over it and got off of metformin. I am starting to finally lose some of that weight and about to look great for senior year. I highly recommend this medicine. It makes me not hungry anymore. I'm so happy now!

The lowest dose  made him stop saying he wanted to kill himself. The doctor up his dosage and I can see my son smile and laugh again. No side effects at all. He even dances now. He's so funny. Before it was a nightmare with him. He's also on Latuda but that takes 3 weeks to kick in. Wellbutrin XL is a life saver for major depression. No more ups and downs.

I'm 16 and am limited to medications that are safe for me to take because of an extreme anxiety order I have. When I first started Wellbutrin it was slow to see changes but now I can honestly say it's helped me so much. Something a lot of people don't know is that it may also help you lose weight in certain situations. I began my sophomore year at about 180 lbs and now I'm at 155. (I am 5'7") I feel so much healthier now and also happier. I highly recommend this for teens who are struggling with other medicines.

Getting started on this medicine can be tricky.  It comes in doses from 75mg immediate release up to 300mg extended release. Due to the stimulant effect it has, you may need to ease into it! Everybody is different. I had to ease into it.For Major Depressive Disorder, it has worked great. I lost weight, my sex drive is through the roof (I'm 54 and feel like a teenager in that respect). I have lots of energy, (sometimes, too much). It doesn't help with my anxiety; I still need Klonopin now and then. It also gives me insomnia, again, the Klonopin helps there. And as other have said, it doesn't "build up" in your system so you don't get the withdrawal SSRI's/SNRI's.

I was diagnosed with major depression several years back. I've been on almost everything out there. I would try the medicine and hate the side effects or how it made me feel and taper myself off. Wellbutrin came on the market and I asked to be put on it. I take 300mg everyday and up until recently it was working great. As I age other emotional problems occurred (anxiety disorder) that Wellbutrin was not helping with, and Effexor was added. Wellbutrin is the ONLY psychotropic medicine I've not had any side effects with and have stayed on as long as I have. It also helped me quit smoking after being a 25 yr /1pk a day smoker.

Well I've been on this medication for three days now. I can tell today that my mood has gone up like way up. I do notice it's hard to sleep or stay a sleep. I maybe have gotten 5 hours each night since I've started. But I feel alive and ambitious.

It's only been four days - I've been told it takes about 2 to 3 weeks for full affect.  I am taking 300 mg per day.  I definitely feel better, but it's subtle at this point (I wanted to go outside and be part of society).  What I'm most surprised about is the lack of side effects (other than no appetite) I have not one side effect.
Helped better than any other antidepressant I have taken (& there have been a few!)  Major depressive disorder is a tricky one. Still working on that (20 yrs.  now), but I'm function able.

I was started on 100 mg of Wellbutrin in January, initially did not note much of a mood alteration other then feeling more energetic. I was upped to 200 mg, and I had never felt better in my entire life. I started performing great in school, had a high energy level and motivation. I was happy and felt good. I lost initially 5 pounds and now I lost a total of 20 in three months (note I also was attempting to lose weight). The only side effects I experienced were hot flashes the first week I took 200 mg which was odd but manageable. Also I had insanely vivid dreams. Recently upped to 300 mg, and I feel manic. It is bizarre, this amazing medicine now does not work, my doc said I may possibly have bipolar depression, So I still highly recommend.

I was diagnosed with major depressive disorder in 2006. My depression comes in cycles, but I take this medication every day. I was on Zoloft for about 3 years off and on and gained about 30 pounds, was tired all the time, and had some discouraging sexual side effects to top everything off. I did my research and discovered Wellbutrin, which other people said was more stimulating and had no sexual side effects. I asked my doctor if I could switch and started tapering off Zoloft while starting 150 mgs of Wellbutrin. My doctor upped the dose to 300 mgs and I had never been happier! It has drastically changed my life. Lost weight and can get up in the morning without being a total grouch. I only gave it a 9 because of the cost.

Was very depressed and hadn't slept in 4 days. Was diagnosed with manic depression and insomnia. Was put on Wellbutrin XL and trazodone for sleep. They both have been a miracle for me. No side effects from either except for dry mouth.
